sections.title: Introduction: GitHub Copilot integration with Visual Studio (preview)
sections.summary: Presenter introduces GitHub Copilot integration inside Visual Studio, noting they're running a preview build where recent changes may appear.
key_actions: Open Visual Studio with GitHub Copilot extension enabled
Note preview version status and potential changed behavior

sections.title: Core Copilot features: inline suggestions and next-edit
sections.summary: Demonstrates the primary features: inline code suggestions while coding and the 'next edit' suggestion capability.
key_actions: Observe inline suggestions appearing as you type
Use the 'next edit' suggestion to accept a multi-line change

sections.title: Settings / Usage: consumption and plan info
sections.summary: Shows options related to usage and plan consumption — presenter checks their Pro plan usage level (28%) for premium requests.
key_actions: Check consumption percentage for premium requests
ui_elements: Plan usage indicator (e.g., '28% of my pro plan')

sections.title: Solution architecture context
sections.summary: Brief overview of the solution architecture: orchestrators, backend, AI frontend, and models used in the project.
key_actions: Identify project components that Copilot may touch (orchestrators, backend, AI frontend, models)
ui_elements: Code files (orchestrators, backend, frontend, model definitions)

sections.title: Copilot modes: Ask mode vs Agent
sections.summary: Explains two interaction modes with Copilot: 'Ask' mode for queries and an 'Agent' mode for a more interactive, side-by-side coding assistant.
key_actions: Switch between Ask mode and Agent mode depending on needs
Use Ask mode for information queries and Agent mode for interactive coding assistance

sections.title: Selecting models and querying current model usage
sections.summary: User asks which OpenAI model the solution is using and selects a model (GPT-5) from the available list.
key_actions: Ask Copilot which OpenAI model the solution currently uses
Open model selector and choose GPT-5

sections.title: Copilot answers: reported models and usage details
sections.summary: Copilot reports that the app host defines GPT-4o-mini and specific embedding models; backend uses embeddings and chat models.
key_actions: Review Copilot's response about configured models
Identify where embeddings and chat models are used in the stack

sections.title: Requests to upgrade models and change to local models; automated file edits
sections.summary: Presenter demonstrates asking Copilot to create a plan to upgrade to GPT-5 and to switch to local models. Copilot can update C# files and Bicep files to perform the changes.
key_actions: Ask Copilot to create an upgrade plan to GPT-5
Allow Copilot to modify C# and Bicep files to implement changes

main_topics: GitHub Copilot integration with Visual Studio
Model selection and model querying (GPT-5, GPT-4o-mini, embeddings)
Automated code and infrastructure updates (C#, Bicep)
